channel.title: RSC Private Server Tutorials
channel.description:
Well, This thread may stop all the pointless posts & demands for tutorials flooding the forums, So Im just going to add a few tutorials ive posted in the past week or so, Please add to it with any tutorials you may see on the forums and il update the list. Evrey little helps i guess, Least now people can scroll down the topic and see if the help they need is listed all in one thread. I doubt it will do any good, but may cut back a few pointless posts.
[b]How to setup basic RSC Private Server using demonik/Divinepk 5.0 Source.[/b]
First of all www.google.com
Download Apache Ant, Wamp, JDK & You need to PORT FORWARD, Port 43595 & 80 Only if using Router, Go into Control Panel - Network connections, Right Click on Local Area Connection, Selet Status, Click the Support Tab on top, And click the ''details'' Button. Get your Default Gateway Adress and type this into your Browsers address bar, Then look for something like games/application sharing? It can vary. And Figure your way round port forwarding.If you get stuck, may i suggest to you http://www.portforward.com/english/routers/port_forwarding/routerindex.htm & select your router from the list. Now....
Place the Apache Ant folder into your C:/
Install Wamp & JDK
Now you will need an RSC Server Source, I'll suggest Demonik/Divine 5.0 for beginners.
Here's the download link - http://uppit.com/WY362S
Now with the source file you just download Divine 5.0.rar, Right click and extract it.
Now find your divine 5.0 folder, and inside it go into MysqlDatabase folder, In here there should be a .txt file named demonik_lsd. Remember that for a second.
Now if you have installed wamp correctly, Goto start menu and run wamp server, A little half clock dial image should appear on your taskbar next to your clock? Left click on this and select from the list phpMyadmin. It should load a webpage in your browser, iexplore or mozilla depending what you use? Now towards the bottom of this page theres a list of selections in blue font, select ''import'' Now it will load another page in your browser, now this is where you need to upload the demonik_lsd file, so click browse and find your demonik_lsd file. Then scroll down and click the ''go'' button. Ok now that is your database uploaded and ready.
Now for your website files so your able to register an account to login with. Go into your divine 5.0 folder again, there should be a folder named ''www'' copy this folder. Now goto My computer - C:/ - wamp. There should already be a www folder here? Delete it and paste the 1 you have just copied from Divine 5.0 folder. That is your website ready. Now to register.
Ok now on your taskbar, left click the wamp clock/dial icon again and select from the list localhost. This will load in your browser your website page, Then obviously, select register on the webpage and register an account for yourself to login with.
Ok now to run the server, Go into your Divine 5.0 folder and then into ''Server'' folder, you should see a file called run.bat? Right click on this and select ''edit'' You will see this.[code]set PATH=%PATH%;C:\apache-ant-1.7.0\bin set JAVA_HOME=C:\Program\Java\jdk1.6.0_04 ant demonikp2p[/code]
Now what you need to do is edit these, to where your java path is and your ant path is, so for e.g where you placed your apache ant folder, go into untill u get to the directory '' C:\apache-ant-1.7.0\bin '' and same with the java, C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_06. Just edit the text from C:\ on wards, do not change the set PATH= etc...
Once this is done, its time to run the client. Go into your Divine 5.0 folder once again, Go into the ''client'' folder and there should be a divinepk client.rar file? Right click and ''extract here'' Now when you have done this, go into the divinepk client folder. And double click the ''run.bat'' it will begin to load, type your username and password you registerd with on website and change the server number from 1 to 2. VERY IMPORTANT.
If this didnt help, ive no idea what will. :S Hope it did though. Dayle.
[b]Demonik/DivinePk 5.0 = How to make yourself Admin.[/b] [URL=http://imageshack.us][IMG]http://img78.imageshack.us/img78/1253/makeadminmy4.jpg[/img][/URL] [URL=http://g.imageshack.us/img78/makeadminmy4.jpg/1/][IMG]http://img78.imageshack.us/img78/makeadminmy4.jpg/1/w1042.png[/img][/URL]
[b]How to edit item stats/aim/power etc...[/b]
Ok, Go into your Divinepk 5.0 folder, Conf, defs, extras.
Now Right click on ItemWieldableDef.xml, click ''open with'' select word pad or notepad, any txt editor you like.
[code] <ItemWieldableDef> <sprite>118</sprite> <type>16</type> <wieldPos>4</wieldPos> <armourPoints>0</armourPoints> <weaponAimPoints>8</weaponAimPoints> <weaponPowerPoints>6</weaponPowerPoints> <magicPoints>0</magicPoints> <prayerPoints>0</prayerPoints> <rangePoints>0</rangePoints> <requiredStats> </requiredStats> <femaleOnly>false</femaleOnly> </ItemWieldableDef>[/code]
Now you will see this, edit which stats of an item you would like, e.g weapon aim? Then were it says ''<weaponAimPoints>8</weaponAimPoints>'' Change the number from eight to whatever you would like. Now save and close this.
You will need a compression tool now, Here. http://uppit.com/4EP68J
In this there will be an input folder, place your edited itemwieldabledef.xml into this, then go back and double click the compress all.bat now go into the output folder and u will now have an itemwieldabledef.xml.gz. Right click on copy this file.
Now go back to your server folder, and delete the itemwieldabledef.xml and itemwieldabledef.xml.gz and paste the new itemwieldabledef.xml.gz, right click and extract it. Now go and run your server, and your items stats will be edited.
[URL=http://imageshack.us][IMG]http://img231.imageshack.us/img231/5039/itemwieldci1.jpg[/img][/URL] [URL=http://g.imageshack.us/g.php?h=231&i=itemwieldci1.jpg][IMG]http://img231.imageshack.us/img231/5039/itemwieldci1.d69faf7807.jpg[/img][/URL] [URL=http://imageshack.us][IMG]http://img222.imageshack.us/img222/7033/item2dv0.jpg[/img][/URL] [URL=http://g.imageshack.us/g.php?h=222&i=item2dv0.jpg][IMG]http://img222.imageshack.us/img222/7033/item2dv0.2a35dc0966.jpg[/img][/URL] [URL=http://imageshack.us][IMG]http://img231.imageshack.us/img231/1795/item3bz0.jpg[/img][/URL] [URL=http://g.imageshack.us/g.php?h=231&i=item3bz0.jpg][IMG]http://img231.imageshack.us/img231/1795/item3bz0.73690053d8.jpg[/img][/URL]

item.title: RSC Private Server Tutorials
item.dc:creator: @xX4m4zingXx xX4m4zingXx
item.description:
@xX4m4zingXx wrote:

i got 3 errors:
in the gameserver run i got

Build Failed Target "runf2p" does not exist in the project "MoparClassic"
in the gameserver compiler i got

[code]Build Failed
build.xml:53: Proglem: failed to create task or type antlib:org.apache.ivy.ant:retrive
Cause: the name is undefined
Action: check the spelling.
Action: check that any custom tasks/types hav ebeen declared
Action: Check that any / declarations have taken place.
No types or tasks have been defined in this namespace yet

this appears to be an antlib declaration.
Action: Ceck that the implementing library exists in one of:
-C:\apache-ant-1.9.0\bin… \lib
-C:\Users\Ruud.ant\lib
-a directory added on command line with the -lib argument[/code]
in the loginserver run i got

Build Failed Target "runls" does not exist in the project "LoginServer".

Read full topic

item.title: RSC Private Server Tutorials
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:94, topic:230652”]Whether there’s an underlying bug or not will have no bearing on a compile-time issue like that one. The java API is written to specification, and backwards compatible. Which means that code that operated under older JVM versions will have the same semantics (with a few exceptions scattered about the place).[/quote]It’s not a compile-time issue… It’s a run-time issue caused solely by the vendor name changing in Java 7, which in turn caused XStream to return the wrong reflection provider, which behaves differently.

Read full topic

item.title: RSC Private Server Tutorials
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Whether there’s an underlying bug or not will have no bearing on a compile-time issue like that one. The java API is written to specification, and backwards compatible. Which means that code that operated under older JVM versions will have the same semantics (with a few exceptions scattered about the place).

Read full topic

item.title: RSC Private Server Tutorials
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

Yea just providing an empty constructor does indeed solve this issue, I actually did it last week using the easy rsc source.

Read full topic

item.title: RSC Private Server Tutorials
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:90, topic:230652”][quote author=CodeForFame link=topic=303688.msg4324224#msg4324224 date=1372631777]

i want to get this working
i got java jdk1.7.0_13
and i got apache-ant-1.9.0
i get this error:

[code]Buildfile: C:\Users\Ruud\Documents\RSPS Stuff\Mijn Server Spullen\RSC\Divine pk v5.0\Server\build.xml

demonikf2p:
[java] [16:47:49 30-06-13] Server starting up…
[java] .\conf
[java] [16:47:50 30-06-13] Connected to MySQL
[java] Exception in thread “main” java.lang.ExceptionInInitializerError
[java] at com.rscd.model.Item.getDef(Item.java:101)
[java] at com.rscd.model.Item.setAmount(Item.java:106)
[java] at com.rscd.model.Item.(Item.java:42)
[java] at com.rscd.io.WorldLoader.propigateItems(WorldLoader.java:39)
[java] at com.rscd.io.WorldLoader.loadWorld(WorldLoader.java:16)
[java] at com.rscd.model.World.getWorld(World.java:272)
[java] at com.rscd.GameEngine.(GameEngine.java:47)
[java] at com.rscd.Server.(Server.java:37)
[java] at com.rscd.Server.main(Server.java:54)
[java] Caused by: com.thoughtworks.xstream.converters.ConversionException: Cannot construct com.rscd.model.Point as it does not have a no-args constructor
[java] ---- Debugging information ----
[java] message : Cannot construct com.rscd.model.Point as it does not have a no-args constructor
[java] line number : 3
[java] path : /map/entry/Point
[java] cause-message : Cannot construct com.rscd.model.Point as it does not have a no-args constructor
[java] class : java.util.Map
[java] cause-exception : com.thoughtworks.xstream.converters.reflection.ObjectAccessException
[java] required-type : com.rscd.model.Point
[java] -------------------------------
[java] at com.thoughtworks.xstream.core.TreeUnmarshaller.convertAnother(TreeUnmarshaller.java:45)
[java] at com.thoughtworks.xstream.core.ReferenceByXPathUnmarshaller.convertAnother(ReferenceByXPathUnmarshaller.java:39)
[java] at com.thoughtworks.xstream.converters.collections.AbstractCollectionConverter.readItem(AbstractCollectionConverter.java:82)
[java] at com.thoughtworks.xstream.converters.collections.MapConverter.populateMap(MapConverter.java:68)
[java] at com.thoughtworks.xstream.converters.collections.MapConverter.unmarshal(MapConverter.java:59)
[java] at com.thoughtworks.xstream.core.TreeUnmarshaller.convertAnother(TreeUnmarshaller.java:38)
[java] at com.thoughtworks.xstream.core.ReferenceByXPathUnmarshaller.convertAnother(ReferenceByXPathUnmarshaller.java:39)
[java] at com.thoughtworks.xstream.core.TreeUnmarshaller.start(TreeUnmarshaller.java:99)
[java] at com.thoughtworks.xstream.core.ReferenceByXPathMarshallingStrategy.unmarshal(ReferenceByXPathMarshallingStrategy.java:12)
[java] at com.thoughtworks.xstream.XStream.unmarshal(XStream.java:552)
[java] at com.thoughtworks.xstream.XStream.unmarshal(XStream.java:540)
[java] at com.thoughtworks.xstream.XStream.fromXML(XStream.java:497)
[java] at com.rscd.util.PersistenceManager.load(PersistenceManager.java:43)
[java] at com.rscd.entityhandling.EntityHandler.(EntityHandler.java:343)
[java] … 9 more
[java] Caused by: com.thoughtworks.xstream.converters.reflection.ObjectAccessException: Cannot construct com.rscd.model.Point as it does not have a no-args constructor
[java] at com.thoughtworks.xstream.converters.reflection.PureJavaReflectionProvider.newInstance(PureJavaReflectionProvider.java:50)
[java] at com.thoughtworks.xstream.converters.reflection.ReflectionConverter.instantiateNewInstance(ReflectionConverter.java:148)
[java] at com.thoughtworks.xstream.converters.reflection.ReflectionConverter.unmarshal(ReflectionConverter.java:90)
[java] at com.thoughtworks.xstream.core.TreeUnmarshaller.convertAnother(TreeUnmarshaller.java:38)
[java] … 22 more

BUILD SUCCESSFUL
Total time: 5 seconds
[/code]
[/quote]It’s already been stated that you can’t use Java 7 with this source… The only source that works with Java 7 is MoparClassic.

Eh? All he needs to do to rectify that issue is add a no-args constructor to the classes in question. I’m pretty sure that it can even be private and still work with XStream.[/quote]I’m pretty sure that doesn’t fix it, seeing there was a bug in XStream and the reflection provider that was being used, which doesn’t produce the same behavior.

Read full topic

[java] at com.thoughtworks.xstream.XStream.unmarshal(XStream.java:552)

[/quote]It’s already been stated that you can’t use Java 7 with this source… The only source that works with Java 7 is MoparClassic.[/quote]
Eh? All he needs to do to rectify that issue is add a no-args constructor to the classes in question. I’m pretty sure that it can even be private and still work with XStream.

item.title: RSC Private Server Tutorials
item.dc:creator: @q3ase q3ase
item.description:
@q3ase wrote:

[quote=“imthenull, post:77, topic:230652”][quote author=Ecko link=topic=303688.msg4202482#msg4202482 date=1358409277]
So is changing the programming language you’re learning every other week.
[/quote]
wot

I haven’t explored a new language in… forever. Nonetheless, I think everyone should try out more languages and not be so bonded to one. What’s wrong with learning the basics a few different languages?[/quote]

2cg0x94.png1002×312

Because you do not know about the basic stuff? Like finding a string takes more time than an integer, If they saved file names as “HELLO” that is a char array of “H”, “E”, “L”, “L”, “O” so when searching a string via the cache they be searching for a char array of that string. Then when searching an integer it be much faster seeming as its just one value not X amount of values.

But I guess your reply of

Jag cache

me either, but eh, it works i guess

You didn’t know that? Please go back to the basics before trying to learn anything else.

The thing jagex does with there caches is store everything as “Names” then they hash all the file names with there own system so it loads as an integer instead of a string value to save time on cache loading.

Read full topic
